attributes.text:
Newly written history managment optimized for Webkit (at the moment).

  • Supports back and forward events in history which is helpful for iPhone-like layer navigation.
Fired every time the history is modified
Native interval event
Internal listener for interval. Used to check for history changes. Converts the native changes to the instance and fires synthetic events to the outside.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property location.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #location}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property location.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #location}.
(Computed) value of location.
Default path to jump to, when no one is given through URL
Should be called after the page is loaded to show the the content based on the loaded hash or go to the default screen.
Initial value for property location.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property location with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #location}.
the default value
A valid URL hash without leading ”#”.
Change hash to the given hash. Completely replaces current location.

Resets the user value of the property location.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #location}.
New value for property location.

Sets the user value of the property location.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #location}.
The unmodified incoming value.
The current location

Returns a singleton instance of this class. On the first call the class is instantiated by calling the constructor with no arguments. All following calls will return this instance.

This method has been added by setting the “type” key in the class definition ({@link qx.Class#define}) to “singleton”.
The singleton instance of this class.
